Posts.EditableText:
there are a few bugs when you use QDK, for example, i had one before, and the reason for it was that QDK was generating the code...


	[quote:1v7jh8ia]description <(Carbralos Inn)
|bExits: |xbEast, Down>[/quote:1v7jh8ia]

and the log was saying...

[quote:1v7jh8ia]FATAL ERROR: Expected closing > character in 'description <(Carbralos Inn)'[/quote:1v7jh8ia]

so what i had to do was either not use QDK and code by hand, or change the QDK room settings so it wasnt Words Only, but Standard Style.

im not so sure what your problem is, but ill have a look now and see if it says anything in the log file.

Posts.EditableText:
STE your error isn't because of anything QDK does by default but because you are retarded and can't use a simple application correctly. You bring nothing to a conversation but your craving for a high posts number.

Otherwise, QDK often generates errors similar to the one you received for a lot of things and in general isn't TOO stable. It will often give errors out if you have too many of layers to your code or if some syntax is entered wrong. Also QDK sometimes writes code in a different, but still acceptable, way than most people would write their ASL. Generally the best solution is to look over anything you recently added to the code, try deleting that and then see if what you are doing works. ASL can be quite picky, the QDK can be even worse. It is recommended you read the help file extensively and learn ASL as it is quite easy. QDK realistically is best used for bug checking your work or figuring out a piece of syntax.

Posts.EditableText: [quote:1s7qyh2x]When I use QDK with it I get a run time error when ever i try to change a compass setting. Runtime error 9 Subscript out of range [/quote:1s7qyh2x] I got this too. So far to prevent it to crash don't click on the arrow on the right of the selection, click on the field and use the arrow on the keyboard to select rooms. It should work (until the bug is corrected ).
